definition: to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss
strange tales and absurd arguments (idiom)/unreasonable remarks

sentences.english: I enjoy listening to his yarns.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜欢听他的奇谈怪论。

sentences.english: I shall report some of the strange remarks I heard in New York.
sentences.chinese: 我将介绍一下我在纽约听到的一些奇谈怪论。

sentences.english: A lot of psychology is charlatanry, chicanery.
sentences.chinese: 很多心理学家都是夸夸奇谈，不实之徒。

sentences.english: The fact that he picked up the phone to call a college kid speaks wonders.
sentences.chinese: 他拿起电话打给一个大学生本身就可称为奇谈。

sentences.english: Otherwise if, hard to avoid has justify oneself , the ill will of exaggerated absurd argument.
sentences.chinese: 否则的话，难免有自圆其说，夸大奇谈之嫌。

sentences.english: It is nothing but a traveller's tale.
Anecdotal instances are open to the criticism of biased selection .
sentences.chinese: 奇谈怪论的例子容易受到带有偏见的选择的批评。

sentences.english: Don't talk about your ridiculous arguments, we don't want to hear them.
sentences.chinese: 赶紧收起你的那些奇谈怪论，我们并不想听。

definition: anecdote/lost or apocryphal story about famous person
sth else/a separate matter/not the same thing/with different jobs (not colleagues)/a remarkable thing/sth special/an odd thing/sth strange or incomprehensible
to slap the table in amazement (idiom); wonderful!/amazing!

dramatic form consisting of historical narration/history as jocular narrative/to stretch history for a joking story/amusing story with strained interpretations of history/to make an unreasonable comparison in jest
variant of 軼聞|轶闻[yi4 wen2]
urban legend (translation of recent Western term)/story or theory circulated as true/same as 都會傳奇|都会传奇
